jinngine.physics.constraint.contact
Interface ContactConstraint

All Superinterfaces:
Constraint
All Known Implementing Classes:
FrictionalContactConstraint, SimplifiedContactConstraint
public interface ContactConstraint
extends Constraint

A constraint the models contact region forces, acting between two bodies. A ContactConstraint acts like any other constraint/joint, for instance BallInSocketJoint. ContactConstraint uses one ore more ContactGenerator instances to supply contact points and contact normals of the involved geometries. When two bodies are subject to a contact constraint, a ContactGenerator for each interacting geometry pair is required. Determining and instantiating these ContactGenerators should be handled by the simulator itself, however, one can create new and possibly optimised ContactGenerators for certain geometry pairs. A trivial example would be a ContactGenerator for the Sphere-Sphere case, which is already implemented in Jinngine, see (SphereContactGenerator).

Method Detail

addGenerator

void addGenerator(ContactGenerator g)
Add a new ContactGenerator for generating contact points and normal vectors. This method is usually called by ContactConstraintManager which takes care of dispatching different contact generators for different geometry interactions. The end-user should not normally be required to call this method.

Parameters:
g - a new ContactGenerator

removeGenerator

void removeGenerator(ContactGenerator g)
Remove a contact generator. See addGenerator.

Parameters:
g - Previously added contact generator to be removed from this contact constraint

getGenerators

java.util.Iterator<ContactGenerator> getGenerators()
Get all contact generators in this contact constraints. This method can be used to get information about the pairs of interacting pairs of Geometry in this contact.

getNumberOfGenerators

double getNumberOfGenerators()
Return the number of contact point generators
